intro: Pilosella echioides subsp. macrocyma, commonly known as the large-seeded hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant features a low-growing stem with dense, hairy foliage that helps it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow with a central disk, blooming in late spring to early summer. Pilosella echioides subsp. macrocyma is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude conditions.
